## Definition

Reiter and Dale (2000) defined Natural Language Generation (NLG) as “the sub-field of artificial intelligence and computational linguistics that is concerned with the construction ofcomputer systems than can produce understandable texts in English or other human languages from some un- derlying non-linguistic representation ofinformation”
